title: No sexual dysfunction from COVID, Health Ministry responds to media reports
body_lines: Responding to several media reports that state that some young people who are infected with COVID-19, are susceptible to sexual dysfunction and subfertility, the Health Ministry said there is no any truth behind such claims.
Speaking to Daily Mirror, COVID-19 Coordinator Dr. Anwar Hamdani said anything of that sort had not been yet scientifically proven and added people should not panic about it.
Moreover, Dr Hamdani reiterated that there was also no truth in any reports that state that booster dose causes infertility.
Thus, he urged people not to be deceived by such false reports, but to take the booster dose as early as possible.
“As far as the booster rollout is concerned, we are now at 52 per cent, which is satisfactory compared to where we were,” he pointed out.
“However, the number still needs to go up in order to feel much comfortable as a nation,” Dr Hamdani added.(Sheain Fernandopulle)
